verses.verse: {The Fall of Babylon} d "Come down and sit in the dust, Virgin Daughter of Babylon. Sit on {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT use another preposition} the ground without a chair, Daughter of the Chaldeans! For no longer will they call you tender and attractive.
Take millstones and grind flour. Remove your veil, strip off your robes, {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b 4QIsa d MT read skirt} bare your legs, and wade through the rivers.
Your nakedness will be {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT read let it be} exposed, and your disgrace will also be seen. I'll take vengeance, and I will spare no mortal.
"Our Redeemer the Lord of the Heavenly Armies is his name is the Holy One of Israel.
"Sit silent, {1QIsa a and MT use alternate forms of the same term} and enter into the darkness, you daughter of the Chaldeans; for no more will they call you Queen of Kingdoms.

I was angry with my people, and {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT lack and} I desecrated my heritage, and gave them into your control. You showed them no mercy; even on the aged you laid your yoke most heavily.

You said, «I will always continue Queen forever!'You didn't take these things into your thinking, nor did you think about their consequences. {1QIsa a and MT use alternate forms; LXX reads the last things}

"Now hear this, you wanton creature, lounging with no cares, and saying to herself: «I am the one, and there will be none besides me; I won't live as a widow, nor will I see {So 1QIsa a ; 4QIsa d MT LXX read know} the loss of children.'

Both of these things will overtake you suddenly on a single day: loss of children and widowhood. They will come upon you in full measure, despite the multitude of your incantations and the great power of your spells."

{Self-Deception of the Babylonians} d "You trusted in your own knowledge. {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read evil} You said, «No one sees me.'Your wisdom and knowledge have misled you. You said in your heart, «I am the one, and there will be none besides me.'

"But disaster will come {So 1QIsa a (feminine); MT (masculine (incorrectly))} upon you, and {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lacks and} you will not know how to charm it away. A calamity will befall you that you will not be able to {So 1QIsa a ; MT lacks to} ward off; and devastation will come upon you suddenly, and {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT lacks and} you won't anticipate it.

"But {So 1QIsa a ; 1QIsa b MT LXX lack But} stand up now with your spells and your many incantations, at which you have labored from your childhood until today, {So 1QIsa a ; childhood. Perhaps you can gain some profit; perhaps you may inspire fear . LXX reads if you can gain some profit .}

according to {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX read You are wearied by} your multiple schemes. Let them stand up now those who conjure {So 1QIsa a LXX; MT reads divide} the heavens and {So 1QIsa a ; MT LXX lack and} gaze at the stars, predicting at the new moons and save you from what is about to happen to them. {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads what things are about to happen to you ; LXX reads what is about to happen to you}

"See, they are just like stubble; fire burns them up. They could not {So 1QIsa a ; MT reads cannot} even save themselves from the power of the flame. There will be no coals for warming oneself, no fire to sit by.
So will they be to you those with whom you toiled and did business since your childhood they wander about, each in his own direction; there is not one who can save you.
